item.title: The plot of life
item.description: A ggplot inspired by the book Storytelling with data. It’s also the logo of the website

item.description: This is a summary. Which is to be know to me. Not by you. By me and only my.

item.title: A Quick Note on Two Beautiful Websites
item.description: To me, the two most impressive websites based on blogdown are: Rob J Hyndman’s personal website. Live Free or Dichotomize by Lucy and Nick et al. I’m sure there will be more.

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This sample post is mainly for blogdown users. If you do not use blogdown, you can skip the first section. 1. Markdown or R Markdown This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: 1. You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```` ```{r} ````); 2.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. Inline code You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.
